page.title: 07FARMING,NORTH SHROPSHIRE
page.content: Most{farms}in the area are owned by the farmers themselves.{Dairy farms use the parlour milking system together with a carousel, a revolving platform on which the cow is milked and fed in one revolution. {Sheep}mostly graze on areas that are inaccessible to cattle. Ewes are shorn in mid-summer and the fleeces sold to the Wool Producers of Wales in Denbigh. There is one{pig breeder}and a{market gardener}producing potatoes, carrots, cabbage and cauliflowers. For both beef and dairy herds grass is important. The ground is fertilised by using end product of cattle rearing muck spreading or distributing pelleted nitrogen, phosphates and potash.
